meanings.definition: Convert (a check or other negotiable paper money) into cash.
meanings.sent1: I need to encash this check at the bank.
meanings.sent2: She decided to encash her savings for a down payment on a house.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to encash a rabbit out of his hat, but it didn't work.
meanings.sent4: His hard work finally paid off, allowing him to encash his dreams into reality.
meanings.sent5: The opportunity to encash the winning lottery ticket was a dream come true.

meanings.definition: To cash in or convert (assets) into cash.
meanings.sent1: They plan to encash their investments to fund their business.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to encash their stocks to cover the losses.
meanings.sent3: The idea to encash their old furniture for a new set seemed like a good plan.
meanings.sent4: She wanted to encash her memories into a book for future generations.
meanings.sent5: The decision to encash the antique collection was a tough one, but necessary.
